channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Medical supplies in great need as aid flows into Myanmar after earthquake
item.description: Emergency aid has streamed into Southeast Asia in the two days since a massive earthquake struck Myanmar and Thailand.

item.title: This may be the most lead polluted place on Earth. Is there any hope?
item.description: The U.N. has identified Kabwe, a city of almost 300,000 people in Zambia, as one of the most polluted places on the planet. Who is to blame? And can j...

item.title: Rosie the Riveters honored for service in WWII
item.description: The National World War Two Museum and the Gary Sinise Foundation celebrate the trailblazing women who worked in the American defense industry in the 1...

item.title: As measles cases rise, some parents become vaccine enthusiasts
item.description: Vaccine hesitancy has been growing in the U.S. in recent years. But as Texas measles cases rise and other states report outbreaks too, some parents wa...

item.title: Trump won't rule out military force to take Greenland
item.description: In an interview with NBC News, Trump refused to rule out military force to acquire Greenland. His remarks come a day after Vice President JD Vance's s...

item.title: Stolen truck collides with vehicles during California police chase
item.description: Ariel footage shows the stolen work truck crashing into multiple vehicles while attempting to evade police in Southern California.

item.title: Here Comes the Sun: David Macaulay and more
item.description: Author David Macaulay sits down with Martha Teichner to discuss how he’s found ways to explain things in his last two dozen books over the course of h...

item.title: Trump roars down multiple paths of retribution as he vowed. Some targets yield while others fight
Trump says he 'couldn't care less' about higher car prices
item.description: Trump says he hopes foreign carmakers raise prices as it means people will buy US-made cars.

item.title: Trump’s promised ‘Liberation Day’ of tariffs is coming. Here’s what it could mean for you
item.description: President Donald Trump says “Liberation Day” is coming. On Wednesday, he plans to roll out a set of tariffs that he promises will free the United Stat...

item.title: "Dead Girls Don't Talk"
item.description: A man charged with murder for poisoning two women tells a friend, "dead girls don't talk." Brave survivors speak out on their behalf. "48 Hours" contr...

item.title: Why British boarding schools are so eager to open in Nigeria
item.description: With UK school fees rising, Nigeria's elite can now choose to give their offspring a British education at home.

item.title: Danish minister scolds Trump administration after Greenland trip
item.description: Denmark's foreign minister posted a video scolding the Trump administration hours after Vice President JD Vance's visit to Greenland.

item.title: Man tending grave probed for starting South Korea fires
item.description: The fire spread rapidly killing 30 people and causing huge damage.

item.title: In pictures: Eid celebrations around the world
item.description: Muslims around the world celebrate Eid al-Fitr, the festival marking the end of Ramadan.

item.title: CBS News poll finds Americans want Trump's focus more on prices, not tariffs
item.description: Most Americans say the matter of Trump administration officials discussing U.S. military plans on the Signal app is serious.

item.title: Wisconsin’s attorney general asks the state Supreme Court to stop Musk’s $1 million payments
The Dish: Pastries and pastry chefs
